title: Three men are charged over attack on left-wing journalist Owen Jones at a north London pub
text:
Three men have been charged following an assault on left-wing journalist Owen Jones at a pub in Islington, London.

James Healy, 39, of Portsmouth, Liam Tracey, 34, of Camden and Charlie Ambrose, 29, of Brighton have been charged by postal requisition with ABH and affray over the incident at The Lexington public house on August 17.

They will appear at Highbury Corner Magistrates' Court on Wednesday, 6 November.

Left-wing political commentator Owen Jones (pictured) was attacked outside The Lexington in north-west London

The Guardian columnist, 35, had been out celebrating his birthday with friends when he was set upon by a group of men.

Met Police detectives previously said they were investigating whether the attack was a hate crime.

Guardian editor Katherine Viner previously condemned the attack.

She said on Saturday evening: 'At the Guardian we deplore the outrageous attack on Owen Jones.

'Violent assaults on journalists or activists have no place in a democratic society.'
description: James Healy, 39, of  Portsmouth, Liam Tracey, 34, of Camden and Charlie Ambrose, 29, of Brighton have been charged with ABH and affray.
